image.altText: A woman with cropped blonde hair, standing outside the courthouse.

props.synopsis: The woman who assaulted a former Northern Territory chief minister with a cream crepe has been sentenced to 12 months imprisonment, fully suspended.

title.children: Woman behind crepe attack on NT chief minister sentenced in court

image.altText: close-up of guns lying on a table.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory government says it does not support the Commonwealth's proposed national gun buyback scheme, stating the territory should not have to share the cost 50:50.

title.children: NT rejects national gun buyback scheme over co-funding proposal

image.altText: Carriages from a derailed freight train.

props.synopsis: A key part of a national freight route is operational again following a 97-hour operation to recover partially derailed wagons, after a derailment between Port Augusta and Port Pirie.

title.children: Freight lines operational again after partial derailment outside Port Pirie

image.altText: A woman in a green top with pandanus trees in the background

props.synopsis: Australia's domestic violence commissioner and local legal services have raised concerns about women's safety at Katherine Local Court, saying urgent upgrades are needed to protect victim-survivors.

title.children: Women forced to discuss DV cases in public at 'unsafe' outback court

image.altText: A woman laying in bed wearing a blue medical suit.

props.synopsis: Women with lipoedema in the Northern Territory are struggling to access the care they need, forcing some to relocate for specialist treatment. The condition, often misunderstood, requires better medical support in regional Australia.

title.children: People with lipoedema face healthcare barriers, forcing some to relocate

image.altText: Beakers water contamination

props.synopsis: The tap water in the Northern Territory town of Katherine — which includes a "designer" mix of river water from the world-famous Nitmiluk National Park and mineral-rich groundwater — has been named Australia's best drop.

title.children: PFAS to perfection: The story behind regional NT town's 'designer' water

image.altText: The edge of a road with burnt buildings to the side

props.synopsis: Firefighters continue to battle fires across the state after the grim news that a person had been found dead and at least 400,000 hectares have been burnt. Follow live.

title.children: Threat of more severe weather in Victoria as 179 homes lost to blazes

image.altText: helicopter hovering above flooded town

props.synopsis: A clean-up is under way at Clermont, which remains cut off by floodwaters, as already-saturated western communities are being warned of possible heavy rains.

title.children: Three people rescued from central Queensland flood as ex-Cyclone Koji moves west

image.altText: Jerome Powell standing at a lectern with Donald Trump behind him.

props.synopsis: A criminal probe into the US Federal Reserve chair threatens to undermine the US dollar and the global monetary system. Local analysts warn the implications for Australia are profound.

title.children: Trump's attack on Federal Reserve 'extremely chilling'

image.altText: Two officers in head-to-toe camouflage stand between a black car and its opened door before getting in

props.synopsis: Minnesota and its two cities sue the Trump administration in a bid to stop an immigration crackdown that led to the fatal shooting of Renee Good last week.

title.children: Minnesota sues federal government to stop immigration crackdown

image.altText: Bondi Beach floral tribute

props.synopsis: There will be a national day of mourning for the victims of the Bondi terror attack this month, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says.

title.children: Albanese calls national day of mourning for Bondi victims

image.altText: Anthony Albanese points at a media conference.

props.synopsis: Directly quoting from a religious text for the purpose of teaching or discussion may provide a defence under the federal government's hate speech laws proposed in the wake of the Bondi terror attack.

title.children: Details of sweeping changes to hate speech and gun laws revealed

image.altText: A woman wearing a hijab standing in front of tents looks exhausted

props.synopsis: Homeless Gazans are begging the Israeli government to allow proper shelters into the strip as winter storms batter the enclave and destroy many people's tents.

title.children: Gazans beg for shelter as winter storms batter millions and Israel limits aid

image.altText: A man wearing a wide-brimmed hat and sunglasses stands next to a woman wearing sunglasses at a marina.

props.synopsis: British Australian retiree Ian Fletcher is meant to be going on a seven-week holiday to the UK with his wife, Vicki, in April, but it may not go ahead due to passport changes.

title.children: New passport changes create headache for Australian British dual citizens

image.altText: A young man in a white polo shirt smiles in a radio studio

props.synopsis: Australia's first openly gay male professional footballer, Josh Cavallo, has alleged his former club was homophobic, something it denies.

title.children: Gay footballer alleges A-League club was homophobic

image.altText: peter malinauskas in a press conference

props.synopsis: Peter Malinaukas becomes tearful during a media conference where he faces extensive questions about the crisis surrounding Adelaide Writers' Week and allegations of homophobia against Adelaide United made by former player Josh Cavallo.

title.children: 'I do my best to settle my conscience': SA premier becomes emotional at press conference

image.altText: ASX

props.synopsis: Australian stocks are trading higher after investors on Wall Street mostly brushed aside concerns about the US Justice Department's criminal investigation of Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell. Follow live.

title.children: ASX rises after Wall Street rally despite Powell probe

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Less than half of Aussies can spot deepfake scams: study
White House on the war path

image.altText: Pink coloured tube with cream coming out.

props.synopsis: There's a large market online for products to put in or on our genital areas, blurring the lines between hygiene, cosmetics and medicine. This is how they hook consumers, and how you can check their claims.

title.children: Honey for vaginal health? How social ads target women

image.altText: A young Japanese boy holds food to his mouth while sitting a table with other kids.

props.synopsis: While Australia grapples with childcare scandals, Japan is delivering top-quality care with professional chefs serving up nutritious food. So how did they do it?

title.children: From 'baby hotels' to restaurant-quality food: Lessons from Japan's childcare system

image.altText: A colourful children's toy block lies sideways in front of a colourful abacus.

props.synopsis: Never-before-seen documents reveal reports of sexual abuse, inappropriate educator discipline, and children missing from ACT childcare centres.

title.children: Thousands of documents show behind the scenes of embattled childcare industry

image.altText: A woman in a white t-shirt leans against a brick wall.

props.synopsis: Throughout her career, former ice dancer Matilda Friend struggled with disordered eating and felt pressure to look a certain way. ABC's Women's Sport survey shows she isn't the only one.

title.children: 'How can I make my body look like that?' The pressures on elite female athletes

image.altText: Group of dead flying foxes

props.synopsis: Wildlife rescuers warn extreme heat could kill more black and grey-headed flying foxes across NSW, with 700 dead animals already removed from two Illawarra camps.

title.children: Bat death toll could rise after hundreds die in heatwave

image.altText: CCTV vision of hooded men in relation to a fatal stabbing in Mt Druitt

props.synopsis: Police have released CCTV of three men dressed in dark hoodies, who they believe can assist with inquiries.

title.children: CCTV released after second person charged over teen's fatal stabbing

image.altText: shot from a chopper, cattle running through floodwater

props.synopsis: Graziers say it was "back to the old days" as under-resourced rain gauges failed in north-west Queensland, with the widespread floods killing almost 50,000 cattle.

title.children: Blame game begins over faulty Queensland rain gauges

image.altText: Three frames of the video positioned alongside each other.

props.synopsis: As images of rows and rows of dead bodies at a morgue in Tehran circulate, the regime is accused of making it impossible for families to grieve.

title.children: Why Iran watchers are sceptical of videos from outside a Tehran morgue

image.altText: Donald Trump speaking into a microphone while holding up his hand.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump takes to social media to announce tariffs, saying they will be "effective immediately".

title.children: Trump says countries doing business with Iran face 25 per cent tariff

image.altText: A handgun lying on a light-coloured sheet.

props.synopsis: A "young boy" from regional New South Wales is accused of making fake emergency calls claiming mass shootings were taking place at major retail and education institutions in the United States.

title.children: 'Widespread alarm and turmoil': NSW boy facing jail over hoax calls to US

image.altText: A group of children playing ice hockey on a frozen lake with houses in the background.

props.synopsis: NATO allies are now scrambling to discuss beefing up Arctic security in the hope it deflects Donald Trump away from his intensifying rhetoric towards the island territory.

title.children: Greenland government rejects American takeover 'under any circumstance'

image.altText: A tall ship sails towards a dock with young people on the sails

props.synopsis: For 38 years, it has been "changing young Australian lives one voyage at a time" — but now it is time for the Young Endeavour to make way for its successor.

title.children: Ship where 'magic happens' for young people is set to retire

image.altText: A black and white image shows the Grok image logo which says 'Grok' next to a stylised black box

props.synopsis: The AI platform championed by Elon Musk has come under significant criticism in recent weeks for its production of non-consensual images.

title.children: Grok blocked in Indonesia and Malaysia as UK launches probe over sexualised images

image.altText: A black and white photo of Eloise Worledge, aged 8, who went missing in 1976.

props.synopsis: Fifty years after an eight-year-old girl vanished from her Beaumaris house, police increase their reward for information from $10,000 to $1 million.

title.children: Police post $1m reward 50 years after Eloise disappeared from bedroom

image.altText: Close up of a platypus face, poking out of a box.

props.synopsis: Landholders living alongside a northern NSW creek say a government plan to demolish a weir to improve fish migration will be devastating for the local platypus population.

title.children: Fears weir demolition could threaten platypus burrows

image.altText: Duct-tape panels on camouflage fabric with straps sitting on short brick fence, foliage behind

props.synopsis: A man allegedly carrying a vest covered in duct-taped objects in Bondi has been arrested and charged by NSW Police, with his vest examined by the bomb disposal unit and deemed safe.

title.children: Man fronts court over duct taped vest near Bondi Beach

image.altText: Alyssa Healy of Australia in a huddle, speaking to the team she captains before fielding

props.synopsis: Australia captain Alyssa Healy announces she will retire from all forms of cricket after a multi-format series against India in February and March.

title.children: Alyssa Healy retiring from cricket after losing 'competitive edge'

image.altText: People walk along a street between ramshackle buildings.

props.synopsis: The case is being watched closely to see how the court might handle other genocide allegations against Israel.

title.children: Rohingya 'targeted for destruction' by Myanmar, ICJ hears
